name: The Shadow of Corellion (Rogue 33 / CoT 6 / SD 1)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Shadow of Corellion 

This looked pretty nice.
Still pretty unrefined as a build draft

Rogue 33 (17d6 sneak attack, Base 41 AB, ITWF shortswords)
CoT 6 to help with ITWF, saves, discipline and +1 APR for 6-7 APR / round depending on haste
SD 1 for HiPS
No exp penalties
Elf for keen senses, +2 dex, detection bonuses

RP wise I thought something regarding some deadly hidden protector of the elven race, hence the Shadow of Corellion concept.

Not a lot of builds go quite so high rogue (ie 33+) I have noted. 
That being said there are a lot of solid gold hits amongst the very high rogue bunch.

Sentry of Anduin by Valerfor is one, ( single wielding shortsword/shield halfling in his build 20d6 sneak looks delightful )
Rogue archer by Torias is an insane min-max sneak rogue archer with SD, 27d6 sneak attack, pretty lethal

Elven Response by Drallimer is the most similar to this, goes 18d6 sneak elf dual shortswords SC V epic dodge, I increase the fort save substantially however (27 vs 21), give it more HP, it was written in 2005 and the epic dodge requirements have changed so it is no longer possible to take it at level 21, but that can be fixed pretty easily I believe in his build, my build seems to have more AB for some reason.

With the uncanny dodge II+ v1.74+ changes to flanking sneak attacks I wonder if high rogues will be more popular. For more 'sneak attack penetration' and defense so to speak. 

Have been trying pretty hard to go ultra high rogue (ie Rogue 39 / SD 1) but each time I do it the draft seems to want ITWF and hence more combat feats, go figure.
I had a try at a Rogue 37 / Fighter 2 / SD 1 build but this combo just seemed better

posts.content: This is a great build, especially if one is wanting to go the self concealment V route. Finally a build with the proper amount of skill points to hp ratio! Any changes I could suggest would just be altering the premise of the build.
